text.p: WCE canola and grain futures pre-opening call as of 0842 CDT, according to analysts.

CANOLA - Steady to C$0.50 higher on CBOT soybean calls capped by overbought sentiments following Tuesday's late local short covering rally. May WCE futures crush profit margin fell to -14.59 Tuesday from -13.65 Monday. July WCE futures crush profit margin Tuesday was -17.48. The Canadian dollar opened flat at C$1.3963 and fell against Japan's yen at 89.84 from 90.31.
FLAX - Steady to C$0.50 higher on spillover strength from other oilseed markets.

WESTERN BARLEY - C$0.10 lower in the nearby on CBOT corn calls with commercial demand seen in the May at C$140 with deferreds seen opening C$0.50 to C$1.00 lower on Saskatchewan Agriculture's bearishly construed acreage estimate setting barley area only two percent lower relative to last spring.
FEED WHEAT - C$0.30 to C$0.50 down on CBOT wheat, corn.
(All values in Canadian dollars/tonne except peas, oats)
